title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2025
text: R-Ladies Ottawa is hosting another data challenge to celebrate International Women‚Äôs Day 2025!

title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2025
text:
The Challenge
At our posit::conf(2024) watch party, we watched ‚ÄúGitHub: How To Tell Your Professional Story‚Äù by Abigail Haddad. In this presentation, Haddad highlighted the importance of building a compelling porfolio that not only highlights your skills, but also explains your professional identity.
For this year‚Äôs data challenge, we encourage you to find YOUR passion project to round out your portfolio and develop your professional story! Take a look at your GitHub profile and ask yourself, what type of project is missing here?
For example, if you participated in last year‚Äôs challenge and created a traditional plot of some sort, this year try creating a visualization using a table, dashboard or another-outside-the-box presentation tool.






For more inspo, be sure to check out our March 2025 event Coding for a Cause with Claudie Larouche!



Check out Haddad‚Äôs presentation below:

title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2025
text:
Guidelines
Although this challenge is hosted by R-Ladies Ottawa, you don‚Äôt have to use R to participate. You could use R, Python, a combination of the two, or anything you‚Äôre comfortable with!
No previous programming experience is required! If you‚Äôre interested in participating, but aren‚Äôt sure where to start, check out the recordings from our Introduction to R workshops that we hosted in early 2024. The workshops will give you a solid foundation in data analysis and data visualization using R.
While anyone is welcome to participate in the challenge and submit an entry, only submissions by women and gender minorities who reside in Canada will be eligible for the prizes.
You can participate individually, or in teams of up to 5 people!

title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2025
text:
Prizes
All submissions from women and gender minorities based in Canada will receive free hex stickers, generously donated by Posit! Among these, the most creative solution (selected by the R-Ladies Ottawa organizing team) will receive a $25 virtual gift card to Maker House! We‚Äôd like to express a huge thank you to Maker House, who offers a curated collection of gifts and homewares crafted locally in Ottawa and Canada üçÅ, for donating this gift card.

title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2025
text:
How to submit an entry
This will be a month-long data challenge, and you‚Äôll have until April 4th, 2025 to submit your entry. Your submission can be in any form you like ‚Äì it can be a Quarto document, an image, a link to a webpage, or a link to a video, for example.
There are two options for submitting an entry:

Option 1 (preferred option): If you have experience with GitHub and Quarto, you can create a pull request on this repository and add your submission to the ‚ÄúSubmissions‚Äù part of this page.
Option 2: If you don‚Äôt have experience with GitHub, you can email ottawa@rladies.org a link to your submission materials and we will add the link to the ‚ÄúSubmissions‚Äù part of this page.

title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2025
text:
Showcasing your analysis
On April 8th, 2025 from 12pm-1pm, R-Ladies Ottawa will host a virtual event where participants can showcase their work. This is a great way to learn from one another and to connect with other like-minded individuals!

title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2025
text:
Submissions

Sofia Balaceanu
Sofia‚Äôs project is called Visualizations of OC Transpo Data Against Canada Census Data and can be found here.


Camy Kam
Camy‚Äôs submission is titled Evaluating Top Nail Salons Near Me in Ottawa, and can be found here.


Alex McSween
Alex‚Äôs submission is a quarto dashboard of her knitting activity over time from ravelry. Alex‚Äôs submission is here and her code is here.


Brittny Vongdara
As a starting point to get familiar with scrollytelling, Brittny used the [closeread] extensions from Quarto to show a fun way to look at data and text about action movies. You can find her submission here.

title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2024
text:
International Women‚Äôs Day takes place on March 8th, 2024. The theme for this year is ‚ÄúInvest in women: Accelerate progress‚Äù.
In honour of this theme, R-Ladies Ottawa is hosting a data challenge!

title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2024
text:
Check out this year‚Äôs submissions!
See the 2024 submissions here

title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2024
text:
Challenge
The objective of this data challenge is to analyze investing in women. This is a very open-ended challenge, so be as creative as you‚Äôd like!
Some examples include:

Analyze venture capital investment data to understand trends in funding for women-led startups.
Analyze businesses or organizations that promote women‚Äôs empowerment.
Analyze data on gender diversity in leadership positions.

You can use any data source, but the following are examples:

Measuring the value of women‚Äôs contribution to the Canadian economy: New insights based on recent work
Statistics Canada‚Äôs Gender, Diversity and Inclusion Statistics Hub
Statistics Canada‚Äôs Average percentage of women and men in management positions tables

title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2024
text:
Guidelines
Although this challenge is hosted by R-Ladies Ottawa, you don‚Äôt have to use R to participate. You could use R, Python, a combination of the two, or anything you‚Äôre comfortable with!
No previous programming experience is required! If you‚Äôre interested in participating, but aren‚Äôt sure where to start, check out the recordings from our Introduction to R workshops that we hosted in early 2024. The workshops will give you a solid foundation in data analysis and data visualization using R.
While anyone is welcome to participate in the challenge and submit an entry, only submissions by women and gender minorities who reside in Canada will be eligible for the prizes.
You can participate individually, or in teams of up to 5 people!

title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2024

Showcasing your analysis
After the submission deadline, R-Ladies Ottawa will host a virtual event where participants can showcase their work. This is a great way to learn from one another and to connect with other like-minded individuals!

title: International Women‚Äôs Day Data Challenge 2024
text:
Submissions

Submissions of Islem Meherzi & Moufida Sidaoui
This submission outlines our participation in the R-Ladies Ottawa data challenge, focusing on analyzing investments in women, specifically within data science research and women‚Äôs health. Our project aims to explore women‚Äôs contributions in data science, investigate global research content, and examine advancements in women‚Äôs health research investments.






More info






Main Objectives

Analyzing Women‚Äôs Contributions in Data Science Research

Identify authors of research papers in data science and assess the significance of women‚Äôs contributions.
Investigate the distribution of research publications conducted by women per country, considering the population size of each country.

Investigating Research on Women‚Äôs Health

Analyze the distribution of research publications on women‚Äôs health per country.
Identify trends in research papers related to women‚Äôs health.




Main Steps

Defining Relevant Keywords


Identified keywords related to data science and data technologies for the first objective.
Identified keywords related to women‚Äôs health for the second objective.


Data Extraction from PubMed


Focused on extracting data concerning the first author of the publication from PubMed.


Gender Detection Using APIs


Utilized APIs to detect the gender of the first author by their name.


Country Extraction Algorithm Developed an algorithm and utilized other sources to extract the most likely and relevant country from the given affiliation in PubMed data.
Data Enhancement


Enhanced the dataset by incorporating additional information such as population and employment ratio.


Content Analysis


Analyzed content based on keywords of the articles.


Dynamic Analysis and Visualization


Performed dynamic analysis and visualization to provide insights into publication details and countries on a map.


Deployment


Deployed the Shiny app using rsconnect (utilizing the free plan of shinyapps.io which permits 25 active hours per month).



Shiny App
We have developed a Shiny app to showcase our analysis and insights. The app dynamically presents details of publications, countries involved, and thematic analysis. You can access the app https://islemmeh.shinyapps.io/shinyappmapsearch/.


Conclusion
Our project involved a systematic approach, from data extraction to analysis and visualization, providing valuable insights into women‚Äôs contributions to data science research and investments in women‚Äôs health. We are confident that our idea can be further evolved, particularly through future optimizations, additional data gathering, and in-depth content and correlation analysis.This project contributes to ongoing efforts to advance the theme of investing in women and accelerating progress in these critical areas.






Nyamekye Asare
I took on this new challenge to build a dashboard based on ‚Äúflexdashboard‚Äù. Nyamekye Asare‚Äôs submission can be found here


Joy Liu
Submission from Joy Liu can be found here.


Alexandra McSween
I created a quarto presentation with some fun astrological analysis of the PWHL. Thank you to Brittny Vongdara for sharing the PWHL idea with me <3 (code here)


Brittny‚Äôs submission
You can find the link to my submission here.
It‚Äôs a quarto presentation with some visualizations using webscraped Professional Women‚Äôs Hockey League data using the fastRhockey R package. I go through some fun plots and walk through how to make my favourite one. Which plot is my favourite? You‚Äôll have to look at my submission to find out ;)

title: Sponsors
text:
Sponsoring R-Ladies Ottawa is a great way to show your support for gender diversity in our community. You can support our local chapter with:

Venue space
Food and beverages
Prizes for coding challenges
Funding for any of the above

If you‚Äôre interested in sponsoring us, please contact the organizers via a direct message on our Meetup Group.

Sponsors
Thank you to the following sponsors for generously donating prizes for R-Ladies events.

title: üë©‚Äçüíª R-Ladies Ottawa
text: R-Ladies is a worldwide organization whose mission is to promote gender diversity in the R community. The R community suffers from an under-representation of minority genders (including but not limited to cis/trans women, trans men, non-binary, genderqueer, agender) in every role and area of participation, whether as leaders, package developers, conference speakers, conference participants, educators, or users.

title: üë©‚Äçüíª R-Ladies Ottawa
text:
üçÅ About the Ottawa Chapter
This website is for the Ottawa chapter of R-Ladies. The Ottawa chapter was founded in 2018. After the pandemic, R-Ladies Ottawa ‚Äúrebooted‚Äù in September 2023. Today, the Ottawa chapter has 1007 members on Meetup!

title: üë©‚Äçüíª R-Ladies Ottawa
text:
ü§ù Interested in joining?






Important



Please note that the mission of R-Ladies is to increase gender diversity in the R community. While our Meetup Group is open to anyone to join, our events are intended to provide a safe space for women and gender minorities. Male allies may attend our in-person events if they are invited by and accompanied by a woman or gender minority.


The best way to keep up to date with our upcoming events is to join our Meetup Group. We post announcements regularly here!
If you are a woman or gender minority, we also recommend joining the global R-Ladies directory and the R-Ladies Community Slack. This is a great way to connect with R-Ladies from other chapters!
If you‚Äôre interested in being an organizer for R-Ladies Ottawa, please contact us through a direct message on our Meetup.

title: üë©‚Äçüíª R-Ladies Ottawa
text:
üé• Recordings of past events
Some of our events are recorded and are posted on the R-Ladies Global YouTube channel. You can find the Ottawa chapter‚Äôs videos under the ‚ÄúR-Ladies Ottawa‚Äù playlist.

title: Feedback
text:
We‚Äôre always looking to improve our events! Use the form below to let us know what‚Äôs working well, what we could do to improve, and any ideas you might have.
